zone.line: me, or be the prey of feelings unsatisfied yet
unquenched. He is dead who called me into
being and when I shall be no more, the ‸very remem-
-brance of us both will speedily perish. I shall
no longer see the sun or stars, or feel the winds
play on my cheeks. Light, feeling & sense will
pass away. And in this condition must I find my
happiness.â€“ Some years ago when the images which
this world affords first opened upon me, when I
felt the cheering warmth of summer, & heard
the rustling of leaves & the music chirping of
birds, & these were all to me, I should have wept
to die, & now it is my only consolation. Polluted
by crimes & torn by the bitterest remorse where can
I find rest but in death.
Farewell. I leave you, & in you the last of
human kind whom these eyes will ever behold.
Farewell, Frankenstein. If thou wert yet alive
& yet cherished a desire of revenge against me,
it would be better satiated in my life than my
destruction. But it was not so. You sought
